O!  MADNESS, thou destroying Angel! — why,</br>Why, in thy fatal grasp embrace my friend?</br>Why bid thy spectres jeer his glaring eye,</br>And make each once lov'd form appear a fiend,</br>And change each once lov'd note to agony,</br>And make each smile, that charm'd him once, now send</br>A dagger — poison'd with the hate of life—</br>Into his soul! — and yet, prolong the mortal strife!

And can no spell of earth dissolve thy power—</br>No "kindred" ties destroy thy dread embrace?—</br>And must thou on a brother's greeting lower,</br>And when a sister's beaming eye would trace</br>The lineaments she lov'd, — still must it cower</br>Beneath thy grim and joy-repelling face?—</br>Thou dark, and sullen minister of wrath,</br>Why wast thou sent on earth, to cross Life's lovely path!

Life's other evils have their antidote—</br>But none for thee, O MADNESS, can we find,</br>When Sorrow with a grievous hand hath smote</br>The bleeding heart, Religion comes to bind</br>And heal the wound; but when thy spectres float</br>Before the shatter'd mirrour of the Mind,</br>What hand, but Heaven's own hand, hath power to quell</br>And chain the "Legion" in their dark and gloomy cell!

I know Thee! — Childhood felt thy burning hand</br>Press hard and heavy on my molten brain!</br>Around my couch I saw my kindred stand,</br>Transform'd into a hideous, Gorgon train;—</br>I strove to smite them with my infant hand,</br>Till struggling nature burst the maniac's chain!—</br>'Twas thy dark, damned deed, vile charlatan—</br>Curs'd be thy fiendish soul, and stolen form of Man!

Heaven! — whatsoever ill thou send'st in wrath,</br>Stop not the cunning mechanism of the mind</br>Till death!  Leave Reason's lamp to light my path;—</br>When quench'd let not Life linger still behind:</br>Oh!  rather with thy nimble lightning scath</br>Me like the Patriot!  Let my spirit find</br>Her fiery pathway through the riven sky,</br>Where thy bright portals open to her home on high!</br>
